titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Herman Emil Mantel Collection of NYU Memorabilia MC.267
titlestmt.author: Stacey Flatt

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-12-14 08:43:59 -0500.

did.unittitle: Herman Emil Mantel Collection of NYU Memorabilia
did.abstract: Herman Emil Mantel (d. 1964) was a multi-degree graduate of New York University, earning his Bachelor of Arts degree in 1908, Master of Arts degree in 1909, and PhD in 1916. He went on to teach and become an administator at Bronx High School of Science. This collection contains 1908 class day booklets and a commencement program, a 1909 Masters in Arts diploma, a 1916 commencement program, and undated photograph of Mantel.
did.physloc: Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Herman Emil Mantel Collection of NYU Memorabilia contains 1908 class day booklets and a commencement program, Mantel's 1909 Masters in Arts diploma, a 1916 commencement program, and an undated portrait of Mantel.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Herman Emil Mantel (d. 1964) graduated from New York University with a Bachelor of Arts degree in 1908, Master of Arts degree in 1909, and PhD in 1916. Mantel taught and was an administrator at the Bronx High School of Science. The Herman E. Mantel Library was dedicated at the Bronx High School of Science in 1966.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection is protected by copyright and/or related rights. You are free to use materials in the collection in any way that is permitted by the copyright and related rights legislation that applies to your use. For other uses you need to obtain permission from the rights-holder(s).

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Susan Johnson, October 2016. The accession number associated with this gift is 2018.036

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Herman Emil Mantel Collection of NYU Memorabilia; MC 267; box number; folder number; New York University Archives, New York University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Materials were placed in acid-free folders and box, and described on the collection-level. Fragile materials were placed in protective enclosures within the folders and labeled as fragile.

controlaccess.subject: Commencement ceremonies
